column4: Hey, how comes when I go into Services I can't edit any of them. They're all greyed out and so is the unlock button.
Hey, how comes when I go into Services I can't edit any of them. They're all greyed out and so is the unlock button.
I understand, but it is very busy in here.
Just wanted to be heard, sorry.
in a terminal, type   groups  . You should see admin in the list you get back
i got admin back... is that good or bad?
that's good, in that you're in the right group; odd, that you can't access services. Try system->admin->software sources
do you get a dialog asking for your password?
Software sources gives me a dialog
i put in my password and that worked
then the sudo subsystem is working. I'm not sure about why the button would be greyed out ....
that's part of the policykit authorization system, which I'm not familiar with, sorry
